subject: Education
title: Plato's Academy: The First University?
description: Learn Plato's Academy: The First University? in one minute.

hook.text: Around 387 BCE, Plato opened a school in an olive grove and it lasted 900 years.

buildup.text: The Academy taught philosophy, math, and astronomy through dialogue and debate.

discovery.text: It introduced the idea that education should pursue truth, not just practical skills.

twist.text: Plato believed most people were unfit for higher learningâ€”education was for an elite.

climax.text: Aristotle studied there, then founded his own rival school, the Lyceum.

punchline.text: One olive grove shaped 2,400 years of higher education.

quiz.question: What made Plato's Academy revolutionary?
options: It pursued truth through dialogue rather than just teaching practical skills
It was the first school to charge tuition
